friendship.title: A friendship born at school
friendship.description: Thomas and Simon met during their engineering studies. United by a shared passion for innovation and sustainability, they decided to tackle together a real challenge for Brussels businesses: soaring energy prices. Their complementarity - Simon's technical expertise and Thomas's systemic vision - allows them to create concrete solutions to democratize access to green energy.

items.question: How does the energy community work?
items.answer: Our community enables solar energy producers to share their surplus with local consumers through a direct contract established by our NPO. This direct approach reduces costs for all participants.

items.question: What are the conditions to join?
items.answer: You simply need to be located in the Brussels-Capital region and have a new generation meter (smart meter). If you don't have one yet, Sibelga can install it for free upon request.

items.question: What is a new generation meter?
items.answer: The new generation meter (smart meter) is an intelligent electricity meter that measures your energy consumption and production in real time. It is essential for participating in an energy community as it enables precise energy sharing between members. Sibelga, the Brussels network operator, installs it for free.

items.question: How much can I save?
items.answer: Members can save up to 30% on their electricity bill depending on their consumption profile. The more energy you consume during sunlight hours, the higher your savings will be.
